Protected Point to Point Primary Messages

Error messages are grouped by functionality.

The text of each message is preceeded with the name of the function issuing it so that it can be found easily by software support.

The Description field includes the message type in parentheses. The meanings of the types are:

  • Critical (CRIT): Caused by system errors
  • Error (ERR): Caused by application errors
  • Warning (WARN): Does not cause application shutdown, but indicate the need for adminstrative correction
  • Notice (NOTICE): Information that is always reported, such as startup
  • Information (INFO): Information such as usage statistics. This may be ignored using the -I command line argument

The Response field describes the most reasonable first approach for troubleshooting the problem.

Primary P3 Key Server Messages

init_key_serv: Key server structure location NULL
Description (ERR):
The P3 primary initializes the mmap'ed buffer shared between the user space appliation and the kernel module and populates it with keys. If there is a problem in the mmap function, the initialization cannot be performed.
Response:
Report the problem to Velocite Systems support.

Primary P3 Network Messages

Primary P3 User Interface Messages

init_pri_ui: Failed to allocate primary user interface data structure: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to allocate the user interface structure during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.

Primary P3 System Messages

p3pri_main: Failed to allocate main p3 primary data structure: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to allocate its main structure before any other activity. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
p3pri_main: Failed to allocate main p3 primary home directory name: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to allocate the home directory name during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
p3pri_main: Failed to allocate main p3 primary home directory name: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to allocate the configuration filename during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
pri_parse_cmdline: Home directory name too large
Description (ERR):
The P3 home directory name exceeds the maximum allowed.
Response:
Correct the command line argument.
pri_parse_cmdline: Failed to allocate main p3 primary home directory name: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to allocate the home directory name during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
pri_parse_cmdline: Configuration filename too large
Description (ERR):
The P3 configuration filename exceeds the maximum allowed.
Response:
Correct the command line argument.
pri_parse_cmdline: Failed to allocate main p3 primary configuration filename: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to allocate the configuration filename during initialization. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
pri_parse_config: config file line number No equal sign
Description (ERR):
The P3 primary configuration file parser did not find an equal sign for a parameter that requires a value.
Response:
Correct the configuration error.
pri_parse_config: config file line number No value
Description (ERR):
The P3 primary configuration file parser did not find a value for a parameter that requires one.
Response:
Correct the configuration error.
pri_parse_config: config file line number No equal sign
Description (ERR):
The P3 primary configuration file parser found a P3 secondary definition before the "localend" keyword was found.
Response:
Correct the configuration error.
pri_parse_config: config file line number Invalid parameter name value
Description (ERR):
The P3 primary configuration file parser found an invalid value for the given parameter.
Response:
Correct the configuration error.
pri_parse_config: config file line number Invalid parameter
Description (ERR):
The P3 primary configuration file parser found an invalid parameter.
Response:
Correct the configuration error.
pri_parse_config: Failed to allocate p3 clustering data structure: reason code
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to allocate the clustering data structure, if configured. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
pri_init_config: Failed to create P3 directory path: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to create the home directory path the first time the application is used. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
pri_init_config: Failed to create primary configuration file: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to create the configuration file the first time the application is used. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
update_sechost: Failed to allocate kernel module command buffer: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary failed to allocate the buffer for sending a remote secondary configuration to the kernel module.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
update_sechost: Counter greater than subnet list
Description (WARN):
The number of subnets defined was greater than the counter in the remote secondary host definition indicated. This means there was a logic error in generating the list.
Response:
Report the problem to Velocite Systems support.
update_sechost: Counter less than subnet list
Description (ERR):
The number of subnets defined was less than the counter in the remote secondary host definition indicated. This means that not all subnet definitions could be sent to the kernel module.
Response:
Report the problem to Velocite Systems support.
update_prihost: Failed to allocate kernel module command buffer: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary failed to allocate the buffer for sending a remote primary configuration to the kernel module.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
update_prihost: Counter greater than subnet list
Description (WARN):
The number of subnets defined was greater than the counter in the remote primary host definition indicated. This means there was a logic error in generating the list.
Response:
Report the problem to Velocite Systems support.
update_prihost: Counter less than subnet list
Description (ERR):
The number of subnets defined was less than the counter in the remote primary host definition indicated. This means that not all subnet definitions could be sent to the kernel module.
Response:
Report the problem to Velocite Systems support.
getsubnetcfg: Failed to allocate subnet configuration file: error reason
Description (CRIT):
The P3 primary attempts to allocate the subnet configuration file. If this fails, there is a system wide problem.
Response:
Troubleshoot the operating system problem based on the error reason.
